name: FL Studio Project
summary: Learn about .FLP files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: FLP files do not store the actual audio that appears in the project. Instead, the files contain references to the audio files. Therefore, if you move an FLP file or the files it references, such as a .WAV sample file, or SimSynth or DrumSynth preset file, the project may not play correctly in FL Studio.
NOTE: FL Studio was formerly known as FruityLoops, which was originally released in 1998. FruityLoops became FL Studio with the release of version 4 in March 2003.

instructions:
To open an FLP file, you will need to have FL Studio digital audio workstation (DAW) software installed on your computer. Here are the general steps to open an FLP file using FL Studio:

Launch FL Studio software on your computer.Click on “File” in the menu bar and select “Open” from the drop-down menu.Browse to the location of the FLP file that you want to open and select it.Click on “Open” to import the FLP file into FL Studio.Once the FLP file is imported, you should be able to access the included project data and settings in FL Studio.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
